greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A triangle constructed from the coefficients of the n-th derivative of the normal probability distribution function.
comment: The n-th derivative of the normal probability distribution function will be a polynomial of n degrees times f(x) of which every other term is zero.
All coefficients are triangular numbers. The second nonzero diagonal are the triangular numbers (A000217), the third nonzero diagonal are the tritriangular numbers (A050534), etc.
reference: Samuel M. Selby, Editor-in-Chief, CRC Standard Mathematical Tables, 21st Edition, 1973, pp. 582.
formula: a(n) = the coefficient list of the x's of the n-th d(e^(-x^2 /2)/dx.
example: f(x) = 1/Sqrt(2*Pi) * e^(-x^2 /2). The polynomial involved in the seventh derivative of the f(x)/dx is (x^7 + 21x^5 - 105x^3 + 105x). Therefore the seventh antidiagonal reads the coefficients as 1, 0, 21, 0, -105, 0, 105.
mathematica: y = E^(-x^2/2); Flatten[ Table[ Reverse[ CoefficientList[ Dt[y, {x, n}]/y, x]], {n, 0, 11} ]]
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 23 2002
